alert.note: Alert for Marathon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 6:43PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Marathon County through 730 PM CDT... At 642 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Rib Mountain, or 11 miles southwest of Wausau, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wausau around 700 PM CDT. Rib Mountain around 705 PM CDT. Weston around 710 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Sunset, Glandon, Camp Phillips Scout Camp, Edgar, Schofield, Halder, Marathon City, Nutterville, Rib Mountain State Park and Rib Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and north central Wisconsin.
